intro: Desmodium leiocarpum, commonly known as smallpod desmodium, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in open woodlands and disturbed soils. Its small, pea-like flowers are usually pink to purple, and it produces slender, hairy pods that contain several seeds. Desmodium leiocarpum is valued for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, making it useful in agricultural systems.
